page.title: 12Public Transport,Marchwood
page.content: The trains that go through Marchwood do not carry any passengers because the passenger line was closed about 20 years ago.Instead it carries oil and freight to and from the refinery.The line was first built in the 1930's.It is a single line track running from Fawley to the main London to Bournemouth line near Totton.2 years ago, because the population had grown so much, some people tried to get British Rail to reopen the line but they refused. Marchwood is also served by 3 bus services.They are the services from Southampton to Calshot, Fawley and Lepe Beach respectively.Buses are important to people in Marchwood because many people work in Totton or Southampton.Also Marchwood has few shops and housewives without cars need buses so they can do their shopping.
